title: Ticket #4500: Condor-C should distinguish auth failure from dead machine
description:
Currently, the C-GAHP doesn't make any distinction between different failures in connecting to the remote schedd. Thus, the gridmanager marks the remote machine as being down on any failure. If the failure is due to authentication or authorization, it should instead put the job on hold with an appropriate error message.

When the C-GAHP calls ConnectQ(), it should provide a CondorError object, and examine that object if ConnectQ() returns failure. If the CondorError object indicates a security problem, the C-GAHP should indicate that in the message returned to the gridmanager, which can then put the job on hold.
